5becf86c-5925-48a4-bd18-27cb46315cd5 Gather the ingredients.
5becf86c-5925-48a4-bd18-27cb46315cd5 Prepare the couscous. In a medium-sized saucepan over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil. Add the couscous and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 3 to 4 minutes or until fragrant and lightly toasted.
5becf86c-5925-48a4-bd18-27cb46315cd5 Add the vegetable broth, bring the mixture to a boil, and then turn down the heat and simmer for 10 to 12 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the couscous is tender. Set aside.
5becf86c-5925-48a4-bd18-27cb46315cd5 While the couscous simmers, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, mushrooms, and white wine and cook, stirring often, for about 5 minutes.
5becf86c-5925-48a4-bd18-27cb46315cd5 Add the dried thyme, fresh parsley, and salt, stirring to combine, and cook for about 3 to 4 minutes more, or until most of the moisture from the mushrooms has evaporated.
5becf86c-5925-48a4-bd18-27cb46315cd5 Add the cooked Israeli couscous to the mushroom mixture, tossing well to combine. Add salt and pepper to taste.
d7f25772-2b35-48ed-87db-54823798d338 Gather the ingredients.
d7f25772-2b35-48ed-87db-54823798d338 Combine couscous, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, garbanzo beans and mint in a large bowl.
d7f25772-2b35-48ed-87db-54823798d338 Whisk together lemon juice and olive oil.
d7f25772-2b35-48ed-87db-54823798d338 Pour over couscous salad and stir well.
d7f25772-2b35-48ed-87db-54823798d338 Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
d7f25772-2b35-48ed-87db-54823798d338 Serve and enjoy!
64b5513a-a471-4b14-be56-a30596388ed3 Pour the coconut milk, water, and salt into a medium-sized saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat.
64b5513a-a471-4b14-be56-a30596388ed3 Pour the couscous into the coconut milk mixture, remove from the heat, cover the pot with a lid, and allow it to sit for 5 minutes.
64b5513a-a471-4b14-be56-a30596388ed3 Add the chopped green onion to the couscous, and fluff with a fork.
64b5513a-a471-4b14-be56-a30596388ed3 Serve as a side dish or top with vegetables, meat or fish for a complete entree.
fd149fff-80ae-4a6a-b9cd-9c96fd65cb18 Cook the bacon until crisp and browned in a large pan over medium heat. Remove bacon from pan, place on paper towels to drain, then crumble. Drain most of the fat from the pan. Add the garlic to the pan and cook for about 30 seconds.
fd149fff-80ae-4a6a-b9cd-9c96fd65cb18 Scrape the garlic and bacon fat remaining in the pan into a small bowl.
fd149fff-80ae-4a6a-b9cd-9c96fd65cb18 Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add salt to flavor, then add the pasta. Stir. Cook until the pasta is just al dente, stirring occasionally.
fd149fff-80ae-4a6a-b9cd-9c96fd65cb18 Meanwhile, add the eggs, mayonnaise, milk, salt, and pepper to the bacon in the small bowl and beat well with a wire whisk until blended and smooth.
fd149fff-80ae-4a6a-b9cd-9c96fd65cb18 When the pasta is cooked, drain, reserving 1/3 cup cooking water. Return the pasta to the pot immediately.
fd149fff-80ae-4a6a-b9cd-9c96fd65cb18 Off the heat, add the mayonnaise mixture. Toss with tongs until the mixture coats the pasta, adding cooking water as needed to make a smooth sauce.
fd149fff-80ae-4a6a-b9cd-9c96fd65cb18 Add the Parmesan cheese and toss again and serve immediately.
c055431c-84c8-4862-b8f4-c74b3b1f45c2 Gather the ingredients.
c055431c-84c8-4862-b8f4-c74b3b1f45c2 Fill a large soup pot with cold water and add a handful or so of Kosher salt. Stir and taste; it should taste like seawater. Cover the pot and heat the water until it boils.
c055431c-84c8-4862-b8f4-c74b3b1f45c2 Drop the fettuccine into the boiling salted water and cook according to package instructions, about 6 to 9 minutes, or until al dente or tender, but still firm to the bite.
c055431c-84c8-4862-b8f4-c74b3b1f45c2 While the fettuccine cooks, heat the butter and cream in a large sauté pan over medium-low heat until it starts to bubble.
c055431c-84c8-4862-b8f4-c74b3b1f45c2 Lower the heat and simmer gently for about 15 minutes or until the sauce has reduced somewhat. Remove from heat.
c055431c-84c8-4862-b8f4-c74b3b1f45c2 Add the cheese and toss until fully mixed. Adjust consistency with additional cream if necessary.
c055431c-84c8-4862-b8f4-c74b3b1f45c2 Stir in the chopped parsley. Season to taste with Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
c055431c-84c8-4862-b8f4-c74b3b1f45c2 Drain the fettuccine and toss with the Alfredo sauce.
c055431c-84c8-4862-b8f4-c74b3b1f45c2 If desired, sprinkle with additional Parmesan cheese and garnish with additional chopped parsley.
c055431c-84c8-4862-b8f4-c74b3b1f45c2 Serve right away and enjoy!
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Whisk together the salt, cayenne pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Sprinkle the chicken cubes with about a third of the seasoning mix and toss to coat.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 In a separate bowl, do the same with the shrimp, using another third of the seasoning mix.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Begin cooking the pasta.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Place a large, deep, heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 When the skillet is hot, add 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and swirl to coat the pan.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Add the chicken to the skillet and quickly sear it on two sides, about 3 minutes, then add the shrimp and brown each side 30 seconds.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Remove the chicken and shrimp to a bowl.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the pan and toss in the kielbasa sausage, tomatoes, bell pepper, and onion.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Sprinkle the sausage and vegetables with the remaining third of the spice blend and cook over high heat until the vegetables are browned and softened.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Add half of the chicken stock and continue cooking over high heat until most of the stock has evaporated.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Add the garlic and wine, stirring for 2 minutes.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Add the remaining chicken stock, along with the reserved chicken and shrimp.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Stir, scraping up the browned bits from the bottom of the skillet, and simmer another 3 minutes or until the liquid is slightly reduced.
29dc437a-25ee-4afc-b8ec-e133f911af17 Serve the jambalaya over the cooked fettuccine.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 Gather the ingredients.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 Remove the skin and bones from the cooked salmon.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 Gently break into large pieces. Set aside.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 Bring water to boil in a large pot over high heat. Add some salt to the boiling water, then add the pasta and stir.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 When you've added the pasta to the water, whisk together the pesto, cream, and sour cream in a large saucepan. Heat this mixture over medium-high heat for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently with a wire whisk.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 Stir the salmon pieces into the cream mixture with a wooden spoon and continue heating over low heat; the mixture will start to simmer.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 Drain the pasta when it is cooked to al dente.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 Add the drained pasta to the salmon mixture along with half of the Parmesan cheese.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 Turn the heat for the saucepan to medium and cook, tossing the mixture gently with tongs until the spaghetti is coated and the mixture is thoroughly heated.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 Serve immediately with the remainder of Parmesan cheese.
e0746ed7-c70a-4366-bbf8-22aeffb3e048 Enjoy!
697551aa-0db8-4835-921e-f390212f8e5c Gather the ingredients.
697551aa-0db8-4835-921e-f390212f8e5c Fill a 3-quart saucepan about halfway full with water.
697551aa-0db8-4835-921e-f390212f8e5c Bring water to a boil, and add the pasta. Cook until pasta is al dente and drain.
697551aa-0db8-4835-921e-f390212f8e5c Meanwhile, make the sauce. In a small saucepan over low to medium heat, heat the oil.
697551aa-0db8-4835-921e-f390212f8e5c Add the flour and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly with a wire whisk until smooth.
697551aa-0db8-4835-921e-f390212f8e5c Continuing to stir, add the soymilk and fresh thyme and bring to a simmer for about 4 to 5 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.
697551aa-0db8-4835-921e-f390212f8e5c Serve with the fettuccine and steamed greens, if desired.
697551aa-0db8-4835-921e-f390212f8e5c Enjoy!
1dc55d4f-8c19-4421-abea-a6ca4ee33253 In a large blender or food processor, combine the silken tofu, vegan margarine, vegan sour cream, vegan cream cheese, Parmesan cheese substitute and the garlic powder.
1dc55d4f-8c19-4421-abea-a6ca4ee33253 Blend until smooth and creamy, then slowly add soy milk a little bit at a time, blending it all together as you go, until you reach a creamy, alfredo-like consistency.
1dc55d4f-8c19-4421-abea-a6ca4ee33253 Transfer the sauce mixture to a medium-sized saucepan and season lightly with salt and pepper.
1dc55d4f-8c19-4421-abea-a6ca4ee33253 Heat the mixture gently over a low or medium heat just until thoroughly heated all the way through (about 6 to 8 minutes), stirring occasionally and being careful that the mixture never comes to a boil. Taste, and adjust seasonings to taste.
1dc55d4f-8c19-4421-abea-a6ca4ee33253 A little extra vegan margarine or vegan Parmesan cheese or salt (sea salt or kosher salt is always best) might be needed at this stage.
1dc55d4f-8c19-4421-abea-a6ca4ee33253 Serve your vegan alfredo sauce over prepared fettuccine pasta, or, use it to make a vegan white pizza or white sauce lasagna.
1e2ddc6b-db65-4e99-8a86-ac1a02d9c585 Cook fettuccine in a pasta pot of boiling salted water (see my article on reduced water pasta) reserving 1/3 cup cooking water, then drain pasta.
1e2ddc6b-db65-4e99-8a86-ac1a02d9c585 While pasta cooks, bring cream and butter to a simmer in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-low heat with salt and pepper. Add fettuccine and 3 tablespoons of reserved water, and cheese to sauce and toss. Add a touch more cooking water if sauce seems too thick to you.
1e2ddc6b-db65-4e99-8a86-ac1a02d9c585 Serve garnished with chopped parsley and additional cheese on the side.
469b72a4-3cfe-404f-a706-cc2c94e5172d Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook the gluten-free brown rice noodles until al dente, according to the manufacturer's instructions. When noodles are just almost done, turn down the heat to medium and add the asparagus spears. Cook until tender-crisp and bright green, about 2 to 3 minutes. Drain pasta and asparagus and set aside.
469b72a4-3cfe-404f-a706-cc2c94e5172d Meanwhile, prepare the chicken. In a small bowl or cup, combine the dried thyme, salt, and pepper. Lightly coat a heavy, large non-stick pan with cooking spray, and heat over medium-high heat. Rub the chicken breasts on all sides with the seasoning mixture, and add the chicken breasts to the pan. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, or until the breasts are golden brown on both sides. Remove the pan from heat and transfer the chicken to a cutting board.
469b72a4-3cfe-404f-a706-cc2c94e5172d Cut the chicken breasts lengthwise into pieces about 1 to 2-inch thick, then return the pieces to the pan and return the pan to the heat. Cook until the pieces are just cooked through, just 2 to 3 minutes more. Add the chicken pieces to the pasta-asparagus mixture. In a small cup or bowl, stir together the cornstarch and water until smooth. Set aside. In the same pan you used to cook the chicken, combine the coconut milk, almond milk, nutritional yeast, salt, lemon pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder over medium-high heat. Stir the ingredients together until combined. Cook, stirring often until steam begins to rise from the surface of the liquid, about 3 to 5 minutes. Add the cornstarch mixture and stir well to incorporate. Stir constantly from this point on, cooking until the mixture just begins to thicken, adding more almond milk if necessary. Remove the pan from heat.
469b72a4-3cfe-404f-a706-cc2c94e5172d Add the pasta, asparagus, chicken, and spinach to the pan, stirring to coat the pasta with the sauce evenly. Portion the pasta onto plates, drizzling any extra sauce over top of each of the servings. Serve immediately with sea salt and freshly ground pepper to taste, if desired.
97ffaa6e-343f-4096-9898-d7382eaeab66 Place the water, beaten egg, butter, and garlic powder in a food processor and mix at low speed until combined.
97ffaa6e-343f-4096-9898-d7382eaeab66 In a large mixing bowl, combine the potato flakes, flour, parsley, and salt.
97ffaa6e-343f-4096-9898-d7382eaeab66 Add the potato flake-flour mixture to the food processor and mix at low speed until a dough forms.
97ffaa6e-343f-4096-9898-d7382eaeab66 Flour your hands and work surface and gently knead the dough, then roll it out flat. Cut the dough into strips and roll the strips into ropes. Cut the ropes into bite-sized pieces and roll each piece on a gnocchi board or along the tines of the fork to create a ridged pattern.
97ffaa6e-343f-4096-9898-d7382eaeab66 Boil in salted water for about 1 to 3 minutes (when they float to the surface, they are ready). Drain with a slotted spoon, rather than a colander, because they are a bit delicate. Toss gently in the sauce of your choice.
08f2ccf4-5c40-499e-a560-0f2a2408e94d Gather the ingredients.
08f2ccf4-5c40-499e-a560-0f2a2408e94d Soak the crustless bread pieces in 1/4 cup of milk until softened, about 5 to 10 minutes.
08f2ccf4-5c40-499e-a560-0f2a2408e94d Meanwhile, puree the nuts, garlic, Parmigiano, oil, salt, nutmeg, and marjoram (if using) together in a food processor or blender, or with a handheld immersion blender, to form a smooth paste. (If you want to do it old-school, use a mortar and pestle to grind the garlic, nuts, salt, nutmeg, and cheese together to a smooth paste before transferring to a separate bowl to stir in the olive oil.)
08f2ccf4-5c40-499e-a560-0f2a2408e94d Add the softened bread to the pureed nut mixture and puree again until smooth and even. Add additional milk, a little bit at a time, as needed to adjust the consistency. It should be about the same thickness as a basil pesto sauce if using on pasta, a bit thinner if using as a spread.
08f2ccf4-5c40-499e-a560-0f2a2408e94d Enjoy.
ada21f1d-8c27-49cb-bbea-b320b3ac6dfb Gather the ingredients.
ada21f1d-8c27-49cb-bbea-b320b3ac6dfb Bring a large, covered pot of water to a rolling boil over high heat, salt it, and add the penne, gnocchi, or other short pasta of choice.
ada21f1d-8c27-49cb-bbea-b320b3ac6dfb Meanwhile, heat the tomato sauce and garlic in a large saucepan.
ada21f1d-8c27-49cb-bbea-b320b3ac6dfb When the tomato sauce reaches a simmer, lower the heat to low, stir in the cream, and heat through, being careful not to let the sauce burn.
ada21f1d-8c27-49cb-bbea-b320b3ac6dfb Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper and remove from the heat.
ada21f1d-8c27-49cb-bbea-b320b3ac6dfb When the pasta or gnocchi are ready, drain it and transfer it to the saucepan.
ada21f1d-8c27-49cb-bbea-b320b3ac6dfb Stir to coat it in the sauce and add the freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano.
ada21f1d-8c27-49cb-bbea-b320b3ac6dfb Toss to coat pasta evenly.
ada21f1d-8c27-49cb-bbea-b320b3ac6dfb Garnish with parsley, more freshly grated cheese if desired, and serve immediately.
b93c9918-2dbe-4dca-84e7-f4f4db3e11cb Bring the milk to a boil, and gradually stir in the semolina, constantly stirring to prevent lumps and keep the mixture from sticking to the pot. The mixture will become quite thick; continue cooking and stirring for about 20 minutes, and remove the pot from the fire.
b93c9918-2dbe-4dca-84e7-f4f4db3e11cb Beat the yolks with a little more milk, and add them to the semolina, together with the cheese, solid butter, and a pinch of salt.
b93c9918-2dbe-4dca-84e7-f4f4db3e11cb Mix well and spread the mixture a little less than a half an inch thick (1 cm) on your work surface.
b93c9918-2dbe-4dca-84e7-f4f4db3e11cb Let the semolina cool for 2 hours, and cut it into squares or diamonds. Butter a pan and layer the squares in it, spreading a little more grated cheese between the layers (there should be 3-4). When all is used up, sprinkle the melted butter over the gnocchi, slowly, to allow it to penetrate.
b93c9918-2dbe-4dca-84e7-f4f4db3e11cb Bake the gnocchi for 15 minutes in a hot (400 F or 200 C) oven, until golden, and serve at once.
577845c0-937a-41e5-a34f-0c32b0036c26 Gather the ingredients.
577845c0-937a-41e5-a34f-0c32b0036c26 Preheat an oven to 375 F and bring a large pot of water to a boil.
577845c0-937a-41e5-a34f-0c32b0036c26 Trim off and discard the ends of the squash and cut it in half lengthwise. Scoop out and discard the seeds and stringy bits from the middle. Cut off and discard the peel. Chop the trimmed and peeled squash into bite-sized pieces. Spread the pieces on a baking sheet, drizzle with the oil, and toss to coat the squash pieces. Sprinkle with the salt and roast until tender and starting to brown, about 30 minutes. Set aside, but leave the oven on.
577845c0-937a-41e5-a34f-0c32b0036c26 Meanwhile, when the water comes to a boil, add enough salt to give the water flavor. Boil the pasta until it is still a tad underdone in the center, drain, and set aside.
577845c0-937a-41e5-a34f-0c32b0036c26 In a pot big enough to fit all of the pasta, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Whisk in the flour and cookâ€”continuing to whiskâ€”until the mixture smells like a pie crust (that smell means the flour is cooked), about 3 minutes. Whisk in the milk and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon until smooth and thickened like a mac and cheese sauce. The sauce should coat the back of the spoon and, when you drag your finger through that coating, it should leave a distinct path. That texture means the sauce is properly thickened.
577845c0-937a-41e5-a34f-0c32b0036c26 Remove the pot from the heat, stir in 3/4 of the mozzarella and 1/2 of the Parmesan, as well as the nutmeg and cayenne, if using. Stir until the cheese is fully melted. Once the cheese is melted, add the pasta and roasted squash until everything is coated and combined. Taste and add salt or more spice, if needed.
577845c0-937a-41e5-a34f-0c32b0036c26 In a small bowl, combine the remaining cheese and the breadcrumbs. Set aside.
577845c0-937a-41e5-a34f-0c32b0036c26 Thoroughly butter, grease, or oil spray a 2-quart baking dish. Add the pasta-squash mixture. Sprinkle the cheese-breadcrumb mixture on top.
577845c0-937a-41e5-a34f-0c32b0036c26 Bake the dish until hot, bubbling into the center of the dish (not just along the edges), and well-browned on top, about 40 minutes.
577845c0-937a-41e5-a34f-0c32b0036c26 Serve hot and enjoy!
800bdbbe-a59f-4e48-8f34-4928afe1b2c0 Gather the ingredients.
800bdbbe-a59f-4e48-8f34-4928afe1b2c0 Heat the oven to 350 F.
800bdbbe-a59f-4e48-8f34-4928afe1b2c0 Lightly butter a 2-quart baking dish or spray the dish with nonstick cooking spray.
800bdbbe-a59f-4e48-8f34-4928afe1b2c0 Cook the macaroni in boiling salted water following the package directions; drain in a colander and rinse with hot water. Set aside while you prepare the sauce.
800bdbbe-a59f-4e48-8f34-4928afe1b2c0 Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, combine the milk and flour; whisk to blend thoroughly. Stir in the salt, onion powder, and pepper. Cook, stirring, over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Stir in the chopped ham, green onions if using, and 2 cups of the shredded cheese. Cook until the cheese has melted; remove from the heat.
800bdbbe-a59f-4e48-8f34-4928afe1b2c0 Add the drained macaroni to the sauce; stir until well blended.
800bdbbe-a59f-4e48-8f34-4928afe1b2c0 In a small bowl, combine the breadcrumbs with the 2 tablespoons of melted butter; stir until all of the breadcrumbs are thoroughly moistened.
800bdbbe-a59f-4e48-8f34-4928afe1b2c0 Spoon the macaroni mixture into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 cup of shredded cheese and then sprinkle the buttered breadcrumbs over the cheese layer.
800bdbbe-a59f-4e48-8f34-4928afe1b2c0 Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or the topping is browned and the casserole is hot and bubbling around the edges.
bad91408-a354-4fa3-8070-a2b8203af899 Preheat oven to 350 F.
bad91408-a354-4fa3-8070-a2b8203af899 Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add macaroni noodles and boil for 5 minutes. Drain.
bad91408-a354-4fa3-8070-a2b8203af899 In a 2-quart baking pan, mix together grated cheddar cheese and noodles.
bad91408-a354-4fa3-8070-a2b8203af899 In a deep skillet or pot over medium heat, melt the butter. Whisk in the flour so paste forms, then slowly start whisking in the milk. Whisk constantly until the flour is smoothly blended in. Bring the milk to a boil, then simmer rapidly for 1 minute to thicken.
bad91408-a354-4fa3-8070-a2b8203af899 Pour the thickened milk into the noodles. Mix well. If adding a topping of cheese, breadcrumbs, etc to the top of the macaroni and cheese, sprinkle it on top of the noodles.
bad91408-a354-4fa3-8070-a2b8203af899 Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes. Let the mac and cheese cool for at least ten minutes before serving.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Gather the ingredients.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Grease a 9- x 13-inch casserole or spray it with cooking oil spray. Preheat the oven to 350 F.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Make the topping. In a small bowl, combine the panko breadcrumbs with the chopped parsley, blue cheese (or Parmesan), and melted butter. Toss to blend the ingredients and set aside.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Place a large saucepan of water over high heat and bring to a bowl. Add the salt and pasta. Reduce the heat to maintain a boil and cook the macaroni following package directions for al dente. Drain the pasta and then transfer it to a large bowl; set aside.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Prepare the chicken. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and celery; cook, stirring, for 5 minutes, or until the celery is softened and the onion is translucent. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Add the hot sauce and the shredded chicken to the onion and celery mixture and simmer for about 1 minute longer, or until hot. Transfer to the bowl with the macaroni and set aside.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Make the cheese sauce. Melt the remaining butter in a saucepan over medium heat (or use the same pan used to cook the macaroni). Add the flour and mustard powder and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Gradually whisk the half-and-half and milk into the flour and butter mixture along with the remaining hot sauce. Cook, stirring, until the sauce is thickened. Add the shredded cheddar and pepper jack cheeses to the sauce along with the sour cream. Stir until the cheese has melted and the mixture is smooth. Taste the sauce and add kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Add the cheese sauce to the bowl with the macaroni and chicken mixture and stir until the ingredients are well combined.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Turn the macaroni mixture into the prepared casserole.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Bake, uncovered, for about 25 minutes, or until the breadcrumb topping is browned and the casserole is bubbling around the edges.
9d062302-8d81-4f65-bb76-9ba474883b21 Serve Buffalo macaroni and cheese with carrot sticks and a garnish of parsley or a drizzle of hot sauce.
5273e5b7-3b3a-4d82-9a61-183369a11fe9 Heat the oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4).
5273e5b7-3b3a-4d82-9a61-183369a11fe9 Butter a 2 1/2-quart baking dish.
5273e5b7-3b3a-4d82-9a61-183369a11fe9 Cook macaroni in boiling salted water following package directions for al dente; drain and transfer to a large bowl.
5273e5b7-3b3a-4d82-9a61-183369a11fe9 To the macaroni add the condensed cream of mushroom soup, milk, tuna, black pepper, seasoned salt, and 2 cups of the shredded cheese. Mix well and transfer to the prepared baking dish.
5273e5b7-3b3a-4d82-9a61-183369a11fe9 Mix the crushed potato chips with the remaining cheese; sprinkle over macaroni mixture.
5273e5b7-3b3a-4d82-9a61-183369a11fe9 Bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 45 minutes.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Gather the ingredients.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta, and cook until al dente, 8 to 9 minutes.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Reserve 1 cup of the pasta water.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Then drain, and transfer pasta to a deep bowl; reserve pot.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Meanwhile, finely chop half of the cilantro. Pick remaining cilantro leaves from stems; discard stems.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Coarsely shred the cheddar cheese.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 In a small bowl, combine the avocado and lemon juice, and mash with the back of a fork or potato masher until smooth and creamy.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Combine the cream cheese, flour and pasta water in the reserved pot over medium heat. Whisk until blended and smooth, 1 to 2 minutes.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Add the cheese, then stir with a wooden spoon or spatula until cheese melts and sauce thickens, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Pour cheese sauce over pasta, and stir until well coated.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Stir in the avocado puree and chopped cilantro.
037a78d2-90d0-47a8-a074-8a5abfe1f561 Garnish with remaining cilantro leaves. Serve immediately.
28eeb49c-978b-431e-b9ee-4e4ab8e138d9 Heat the oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4). Butter a 2 1/2- to 3-quart baking dish.
28eeb49c-978b-431e-b9ee-4e4ab8e138d9 Bring a large pot of about 4 quarts of water to a boil over high heat. Add about 1 tablespoon of salt to the water. Add the macaroni, reduce the heat to medium, and continue boiling until al dente** following package directions. Drain the macaroni well.
28eeb49c-978b-431e-b9ee-4e4ab8e138d9 In a bowl combine the mayonnaise, cream cheese, shredded cheese, drained pimientos, and grated onion. Mix the ingredients together until thoroughly blended. Taste and add salt and freshly ground black pepper, as needed. Add the hot drained macaroni and mix until well blended.
28eeb49c-978b-431e-b9ee-4e4ab8e138d9 Spoon the macaroni and pimiento cheese mixture into the prepared baking dish.
28eeb49c-978b-431e-b9ee-4e4ab8e138d9 Sprinkle the French fried onions over the casserole.
28eeb49c-978b-431e-b9ee-4e4ab8e138d9 Bake for about 20 to 25 minutes, or until the macaroni and cheese mixture is hot and bubbling around the edges and the topping is lightly browned and crispy.
28eeb49c-978b-431e-b9ee-4e4ab8e138d9 Serve with a simple tossed green salad or fresh sliced tomatoes, or serve it along with a holiday meal or Sunday dinner.
99e94ad6-54b7-4156-bc54-345ee696402d Gather the ingredients.
99e94ad6-54b7-4156-bc54-345ee696402d Cook the pasta in boiling salted water following the package directions.
99e94ad6-54b7-4156-bc54-345ee696402d Drain in a colander and rinse under hot water. Set aside.
99e94ad6-54b7-4156-bc54-345ee696402d In a large deep skillet or saucepan, heat the vegetable oil and butter over medium heat.
99e94ad6-54b7-4156-bc54-345ee696402d Add the onion and bell pepper, if using. Cook, stirring until onion is softened and edges are lightly browned.
99e94ad6-54b7-4156-bc54-345ee696402d Add the ground beef and cook, stirring and breaking up, until the beef is cooked through and no longer pink.
99e94ad6-54b7-4156-bc54-345ee696402d Add the garlic and garlic powder and cook, stirring for 1 to 2 minutes longer.
99e94ad6-54b7-4156-bc54-345ee696402d Stir in the crushed tomatoes and diced tomatoes, the tomato sauce and paste, sugar, and pepper. Cook, stirring, until the sauce mixture begins to boil. Taste and add salt, as needed. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes.
99e94ad6-54b7-4156-bc54-345ee696402d Add the drained macaroni to the sauce, mix well, and heat through. Serve and enjoy!
581c1fc9-68c3-4163-8151-443d4a9845cb Gather the ingredients.
581c1fc9-68c3-4163-8151-443d4a9845cb Bring a pot of salted water to a rolling boil and cook the gluten-free pasta according to the manufacturer's instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
581c1fc9-68c3-4163-8151-443d4a9845cb Prepare the sauce. In a small bowl or cup, combine the nutritional yeast, sea salt, onion powder, and garlic powder. Set aside. In a medium-sized saucepan, heat the olive oil or canola oil over medium-low heat. Whisk in the sweet rice flour and continue whisking constantly for 3-5 minutes or until the flour smells toasty but hasn't browned. In a steady stream, whisk in the almond milk or coconut milk, stirring constantly. Add in the nutritional yeast mixture and the rice vinegar, and cook for three minutes more or until the sauce is slightly thickened. If using, add in the gluten-free vegan cheese shreds and mix until just incorporated.
581c1fc9-68c3-4163-8151-443d4a9845cb Toss the pasta with the sauce and cook for just a minute or two more to reheat the pasta. Serve immediately, serving with freshly ground black pepper and salt to taste.
24c08d1a-8604-4841-9f29-79cb6aa95944 Poke the potatoes all over with a fork, sticking each potato 8-10 times. Microwave them on high for about 10 minutes, or bake them in a 350F oven for about an hour, or until soft all the way through. Let cool for about 15 minutes.
24c08d1a-8604-4841-9f29-79cb6aa95944 Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out the flesh with a spoon (use a dish towel to protect your hand if the potatoes are too hot). Discard the skins or reserve for another use, like cheesy potato skins.
24c08d1a-8604-4841-9f29-79cb6aa95944 Pass the scooped potato through a ricer (or mash with a masher or fork) then, using a one-cup measuring cup, measure two lightly packed cups of mashed potato. Reserve any remaining potato another use.
24c08d1a-8604-4841-9f29-79cb6aa95944 Transfer the two cups of mashed potato to a large bowl. Add the salt and egg yolks and combine, then add the flour and knead by hand until the yolk is completely distributed and the dough is the texture of play-doh. No need to knead for a long time; just incorporating the flour should get you there.
24c08d1a-8604-4841-9f29-79cb6aa95944 Divide the dough into four pieces. Roll one of the pieces into a long rope about 1/2-inch thick. Cut the rope into half-inch (gnocchi-sized) nuggets. You can gently roll each nugget between your hand and the tines of a fork to create "gnocchi ridges," but you can skip this step if youâ€™re short on time. Place the finished gnocchi on a flour-dusted sheet pan. Repeat with the remaining three portions of dough.
24c08d1a-8604-4841-9f29-79cb6aa95944 Bring about 4 quarts of water to a rolling boil in a large pot. Add about 2 tablespoons of salt to the boiling water.
24c08d1a-8604-4841-9f29-79cb6aa95944 While the water is boiling, prepare the sauce. Add the butter and milk to a large skillet over medium heat and whisk in the packet of cheese sauce. Keep whisking until all the lumps are gone. If the sauce seems a little thin, let it bubble and reduce for a minute or two, but donâ€™t let it get too concentrated or it may be too salty.
24c08d1a-8604-4841-9f29-79cb6aa95944 Add the gnocchi to the boiling water and give them a quick stir to prevent clumping. When they begin to float, leave them boiling in the water for another two minutes.
24c08d1a-8604-4841-9f29-79cb6aa95944 Remove the gnocchi with a slotted spoon, or drain them in a colander before adding them to the pan with cheese sauce. Stir to coat the gnocchi completely with orange (or white, if thatâ€™s your thing) goodness. Remove from heat, and serve immediately.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Gather the ingredients.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Grease a 2-quart baking dish.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Heat oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Cook the pasta in boiling salted water following package directions. Drain and rinse; set aside.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, melt 4 tablespoons of butter. Add the flour and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly. â€‹
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Gradually add the milk, or half-and-half, and Boursin cheese. Cook, stirring, until hot and thickened.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Add the cheese and peppers. Continue cooking until the cheese has melted, stirring constantly. Add salt and pepper, to taste. If necessary, thin slightly with extra milk.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Combine the sauce with the pasta and stir to blend. Spoon into prepared baking dish.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Toss melted butter and bread crumbs together until the crumbs are thoroughly coated; sprinkle over the casserole.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes, or until bubbly and lightly browned.
831e867b-4682-4ae0-a70c-c15cba56cb3b Scoop the mac and cheese onto serving plates or bowls and enjoy!
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Boil the macaroni in abundant salted water just until al dente (7 to 12 minutes, depending on the type of pasta you are using).
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Drain well, rinse in cold water, drain well again and set aside.
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 425 F / 220 C and make the besciamella (white sauce):
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 When it's melted, whisk in the flour.
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Turn the heat to low and cook, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon to prevent lumps and burning, until the roux (flour-and-butter mixture) is just slightly golden brown and has a nutty scent, 1 to 2 minutes.
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Gently whisk in the milk whisking continuously to prevent lumps.
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Continue cooking until the mixture starts to thicken, another 1 to 2 minutes.
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Stir in the grated cheeses, a little at a time, until they are completely melted.
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Season to taste with salt and pepper. You have made a Mornay sauce (besciamella sauce with cheese).
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Stir in the cooked macaroni and toss until evenly coated.
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Transfer the macaroni to an 11-inch by 7-inch baking dish.
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Pat the macaroni down with the back of a spatula or wooden spoon so that it is compact and of even height.
3d860aaf-eeb6-4b9e-b70f-5889e474e338 Sprinkle the top generously with bread crumbs and bake for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the top is crisp and golden-brown.
7bf889d9-3ba5-4183-8f0c-4d451c999f10 Gather the ingredients.
7bf889d9-3ba5-4183-8f0c-4d451c999f10 Heat oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4).
7bf889d9-3ba5-4183-8f0c-4d451c999f10 Grease a 2-quart baking dish or spray with cooking oil spray.
7bf889d9-3ba5-4183-8f0c-4d451c999f10 Cook the macaroni following package directions; drain in a colander and rinse with hot water.
7bf889d9-3ba5-4183-8f0c-4d451c999f10 In a bowl, combine the cheddar and American cheeses. Set aside.
7bf889d9-3ba5-4183-8f0c-4d451c999f10 In a medium saucepan melt the 4 tablespoons of butter over medium heat until hot and foamy; stir in the flour until bubbly. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually add the milk and cream along with the salt, pepper, and ground mustard. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened. Add 2 cups of the cheese blend and continue cooking until melted, stirring constantly.
7bf889d9-3ba5-4183-8f0c-4d451c999f10 Add the drained macaroni to the sauce and stir to blend. Pour the macaroni and cheese into the prepared baking dish. Top with the remaining 1 cup of shredded cheese
7bf889d9-3ba5-4183-8f0c-4d451c999f10 Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and toss with the breadcrumbs. Sprinkle over the cheese layer.
7bf889d9-3ba5-4183-8f0c-4d451c999f10 Bake for 25 to 35 minutes, until bubbly and nicely browned.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Gather the ingredients.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Preheat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Butter a 2 1/2 to 3-quart shallow baking dish or casserole.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Cook the penne pasta in boiling salted water as directed on package; drain well and set aside.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion to the pan and cook for about 4 minutes, or until it is translucent. Add the garlic to the onion and continue cooking for 1 minute.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Add the tomatoes, basil, and oregano to the onion and garlic. Cook until heated through, stirring frequently.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Taste and add salt and pepper.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 In a large bowl, combine the cooked, drained penne, the tomato sauce mixture, and 1 cup of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Stir to blend the ingredients thoroughly.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Spoon the pasta and sauce mixture into the prepared casserole.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Sprinkle the remaining 1 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese over the top.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Bake the casserole for about 20 to 25 minutes, or until the pasta is hot and bubbly and the cheese has melted.
bd84cf99-e326-4136-a482-d1bb3ee48d00 Serve and enjoy!
8730660e-7fe3-48d1-9ea4-38045c70e2de Gather the ingredients.
8730660e-7fe3-48d1-9ea4-38045c70e2de Cook the pasta according to the package instructions. If you are using gluten-free pasta, be sure to rinse with cool water after cooking.
8730660e-7fe3-48d1-9ea4-38045c70e2de After the pasta has cooked, return to the pot and stir in the 1 teaspoon olive oil and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Fold in gently to evenly coat the pasta.
8730660e-7fe3-48d1-9ea4-38045c70e2de Sprinkle with black pepper and then set aside while you prepare the sauce.
8730660e-7fe3-48d1-9ea4-38045c70e2de In a small saucepan (about 2 to 3 quarts) heat the minced garlic, grated onion, and 1 teaspoon cooking oil over medium-high heat until the garlic and onion are fragrant and slightly darker in color, about 4 minutes. Stir often so as not to burn the garlic and onion.
8730660e-7fe3-48d1-9ea4-38045c70e2de Add the canned pumpkin, nutritional yeast flakes, salt, and milk and warm gently over low heat about 5 minutes.
8730660e-7fe3-48d1-9ea4-38045c70e2de Transfer the pumpkin sauce mixture to a high-speed blender and add the pecans. (You may need to allow the sauce to cool briefly before proceeding.)
8730660e-7fe3-48d1-9ea4-38045c70e2de Blend the mixture until the sauce is completely smooth, stopping and scraping the sides of the blender as needed.
8730660e-7fe3-48d1-9ea4-38045c70e2de Add the sauce to the cooked pasta and stir gently to completely coat.
8730660e-7fe3-48d1-9ea4-38045c70e2de Serve immediately.
e7ac9133-c143-4689-af9e-c17bd2cb3266 Gather the ingredients.
e7ac9133-c143-4689-af9e-c17bd2cb3266 Gently warm the olive oil in a large saucepan to medium-hot. Add the onion, carrot, and celery, stir into the oil, and cook on medium heat for 10 minutes until the vegetables are softened. Add the garlic, stir and cook for a further 3 minutes.
e7ac9133-c143-4689-af9e-c17bd2cb3266 Add the cans of chopped of tomatoes and torn basil leaves, cooking over a gentle heat for 20 to 30 minutes, or until the sauce is thickened and all the vegetables have softened. You can make the sauce to this point ahead of time if you wish, then cool it and store until required.
e7ac9133-c143-4689-af9e-c17bd2cb3266 Warm the tomato sauce through until it is just gently bubbling, stir in the heavy cream, keep the sauce on a very low heat while you cook the pasta.
e7ac9133-c143-4689-af9e-c17bd2cb3266 Cook the penne according to the packet instructions, but stop two minutes befroe the recommended cooking time. Use a large volume of rapidly boiling water with the sea salt added.
e7ac9133-c143-4689-af9e-c17bd2cb3266 Once cooked, drain the penne, then return it to the pan, add the vodka and butter and stir. Add the cooked, warm tomato sauce and toss together with the pasta.
e7ac9133-c143-4689-af9e-c17bd2cb3266 Serve immediately into hot bowls with a good sprinkling of freshly grated Parmesan cheese, a little black pepper, and chili flakes if you like a little heat.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 Gather the ingredients.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 Set a large pot of water to boil over high heat for the pasta.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 In a saucepan over medium heat, sauté the onion (if you are using it) and the garlic in half (2 tablespoons) of the oil, until fragrant and just barely golden - about 2 to 3 minutes.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 Add the crushed red peppers or the fresh chile pepper and cook for another 30 seconds, until fragrant.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 Add the tomatoes and lower the heat to low. Simmer, covered, while you cook the pasta.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 In the meantime, cook the pasta in the salted boiling water to al dente.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 Drain it and return it to the pot.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 Check the seasoning of the sauce and stir in the basil and the remainder of the oil.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 Pour the sauce over the pasta and toss to cover evenly.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 Serve the pasta with the grated cheese on the side.
52995a99-c440-4755-bb96-7524cc6bf5f3 Enjoy!
348c5d10-8586-4cd9-8491-15613429816b Preheat the oven to 350 F.
348c5d10-8586-4cd9-8491-15613429816b Cook the tortellini according to the package directions and drain.
348c5d10-8586-4cd9-8491-15613429816b Combine the pasta with the broccoli, sauce, and chicken in a large bowl.
348c5d10-8586-4cd9-8491-15613429816b Transfer to a 1-1/2 quart casserole dish and top with the bread crumbs.
348c5d10-8586-4cd9-8491-15613429816b Bake at 350 F for 25 to 35 minutes or until the casserole is bubbling and the bread crumbs are browned.
fc03f6a0-02ee-42c3-918e-a28a9f8a817b Preheat the oven to 350 F.
fc03f6a0-02ee-42c3-918e-a28a9f8a817b In a three-quart glass baking dish, layer the frozen tortellini and the spaghetti sauce. Put the water into the empty sauce jar, close the lid tightly, and shake well. Pour this mixture over the tortellini. That's how you get all of the spaghetti sauce out of the jar, and the water helps the tortellini cook and stay tender.
fc03f6a0-02ee-42c3-918e-a28a9f8a817b Spoon the Alfredo sauce over the tortellini, making sure that all of the little pasta is completely covered. Place the milk into the empty Alfredo sauce jar, close the lid tightly, and shake. Then drizzle this mixture over the casserole to get all of the sauce out of the jar.
fc03f6a0-02ee-42c3-918e-a28a9f8a817b At this point, you can top the casserole with frozen meatballs, if using. Sprinkle with the cheese.
fc03f6a0-02ee-42c3-918e-a28a9f8a817b Cover the casserole tightly with foil and bake at 350 F for 55 minutes. Then uncover the casserole and bake for 10 to 15 minutes longer, until the tortellini is tender, the sauce is bubbling, the cheese is melted, and the meatballs are hot.
3473ebd6-83cd-4e20-a093-3de55a74bd33 Cook the sausage in a heavy skillet over medium heat until browned, about 10 minutes. Stir the sausage frequently to break up as it cooks.
3473ebd6-83cd-4e20-a093-3de55a74bd33 Drain well and place in 4 to 5-quart slow cooker. Add the pasta sauce, tomatoes, and Italian seasoning and stir well.
3473ebd6-83cd-4e20-a093-3de55a74bd33 Cover and cook on low for 7 to 8 hours. Then stir in the tortellini, cover again, and cook on low for 20 to 40 minutes or until the pasta is tender and heated. Sprinkle with cheese and let stand 5 minutes before serving.

80f22115-a3a5-4888-bb07-48265c966f3f For the Seffa:
80f22115-a3a5-4888-bb07-48265c966f3f 2 lbs. (about 1 kg) dry broken vermicelli or couscous
80f22115-a3a5-4888-bb07-48265c966f3f 3 tablespoons vegetable or olive oil
